file_content.text: The Imps are in for a big surprise when they finally evacuate this planet.
The trackers are in place.
Excellent. I knew I made the right choice when I tagged you for this mission. I have an eye for spotting talent.
That's probably why they gave me this mission. Nobody else could have pulled it off.
My pleasure.
Don't break your arm patting yourself on the back. All you did was ask me for help.
I did all the work.
Don't worry, you'll get the credit you're due.
Let's talk compensation.
I wasn't going to try and stiff you, if that's what you're worried about.
I'll make sure my superiors understand this was a joint effort when I file my report.
Maybe we'll get a chance to work together again sometime.
Plant those trackers on everything you find at the Empire's construction site.
Pleased to meet you. Agent Jaylla Noh, Strategic Information Service.
Let me ask you a question. Are you dedicated--truly dedicated--to seeing the Republic achieve ultimate victory here on Balmorra?
I'm not leaving until every last enemy force is driven off this world.
That's why I'm here.
Surely you know my order is one of your staunchest allies.
The Jedi serve the Republic.
No retreat, no surrender.
Those are my orders.
Good. We're on the same page. But true victory is more than just reclaiming the planet.
I'd rather see the Republic on top than the Imperials. Not getting myself killed to make it happen, though.
I've got a vested interest.
Close enough, I suppose. But victory isn't just winning Balmorra.
Obviously I want the Republic to win. What are you really getting at?
Is this a trick?
I don't think I like your tone.
You doubt me?
Relax. This isn't about you. Not yet, anyway. First, I need to see if you have vision.
If we drive the Imperials off Balmorra, they'll retreat to one of their own worlds. But that isn't victory.
They'll rebuild their strength, and eventually they'll attack us again. It's a pointless cycle I intend to stop once and for all.
Balmorra is just one world, but it's a key to defeating the Empire once and for all.
Eventually we'll break them.
True, but we can accelerate the process. Instead of being reactive, we can be aggressive.
That's a bold statement.
When you say you intend to stop it, you really mean I'm going to do all the work, don't you?
And you need my help, right?
I wouldn't say you're doing all the work. After all, I had to come up with the plan. I'm quite proud of it, actually.
If someone can plant tracking devices on key Imperial vehicles and equipment, we can use it to follow them when they retreat.
Wherever they run to, we can send reinforcements to hit them again before they regroup. We'll crush them once and for all!
I like it.
I'm glad you agree. There's a short list of people who can pull this off. I think you just might be on that list.
You do realize planting the tracking devices means fighting into the heart of an Imperial camp, right?
It's not that simple.
That's where you come in. I've seen the reports. Facing overwhelming odds is kind of your specialty. This should be no problem for you.
The Imps are digging some kind of tunnel nearby. Place a tracker on everything you can find there: vehicles, terminals, even transport crates.
Remember: Driving the Imperials off Balmorra is only the beginning. We also have to make sure they never come back.
Pass. [Refuse quest]
I thought you were someone who understood the importance of planning ahead. Guess I was wrong.
No time to chat. Too many pots on the stove.
